New York Daily News, one of many: Army commandoes were dispatched over the weekend to protect the 108-year-old museum in Cairo's Tahrir square, where many of the nation's protesters have gathered over the last week. `` I was so worried,'' Zahi Hawass , Egypt's chief archeologist and secretary general of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, told The Washington Post.`` I have been protecting antiquities all my life. civilians formed a human chain to protect the building. Dozens of looters were detained over several days and most appeared unaware of the value of what was in the museum, gleefully ransacking the gift shop. They thought that the museum shop was the museum, said Zahi Hawass , Egypt's top archaeologist.`` These people are ignorant, they are outlaws.''
